Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav was named player of the match.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 57 runs off 21 balls in the last six overs.
KL Rahul scored a fifty off 34 balls.
Virat Kohli reclaimed his position as the top run-scorer of the tournament.
Zimbabwe's best partnership was 58 runs off 33 balls between Sikandar Raza and Ryan Burl.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar took a wicket on the first ball of Zimbabwe's innings.
Arshdeep Singh bowled Regis Chakabva with a swinging delivery.
Hardik Pandya took a catch to dismiss Craig Ervine.
Mohammad Shami took a wicket in the powerplay.
Ryan Burl took an excellent catch to dismiss Rishabh Pant.
Pre-Game Insights: Rishabh Pant was included in the playing XI for the first time in the tournament, replacing Dinesh Karthik.
Zimbabwe included left-arm spinner Wellington Masakadza and offspin-bowling allrounder Tony Munyonga.
India had already qualified for the semi-finals after South Africa's loss to the Netherlands.
If India won, they would top the group and face England in the semi-finals. If they lost, they would face New Zealand.
Post-Match Reflections: India will play England in the second semi-final in Adelaide.
A huge crowd of more than 82,000 people attended the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Melbourne Cricket Ground.
Zimbabwe were all out for 115 in 17.2 overs.
